greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of semiprimes <= 2^n.
link: Dana Jacobsen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..57 (first 49 terms from Robert G. Wilson v, corrected a(48)).
mathematica: SemiPrimePi[n_] := Sum[ PrimePi[ n/Prime@i] - i + 1, {i, PrimePi@ Sqrt@n}]; Table[ SemiPrimePi[2^n], {n, 47}]
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(s,i,N=2^n); forprime(p=2, sqrtint(N), s+=primepi(N\p); i++); s - i * (i-1)/2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 12 2013
(Perl) use ntheory ":all"; print "$_ ",semiprime_count(1 << $_),"\n" for 1..48; # _Dana Jacobsen_, Sep 10 2018
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 29 2006
